Origin of the Palestine-Israel Conflict
 
 Published by: Jews for Justice in the Middle East
 
 
 As the periodic bloodshed continues in the Middle East, the search for an equitable solution must come to grips with the root cause of the conflict. The conventional wisdom is that, even if both sides are at fault, the Palestinians are irrational "terrorists" who have no point of view worth listening to. Our position, however, is that the Palestinians have a real grievance: their homeland for over a thousand years was taken, without their consent and mostly by force, during the creation of the state of Israel. And all subsequent crimes - on both sides - inevitably follow from this original injustice.
 
 The mythic "land without people for a people without land" was already home to 700,000 Palestinians in 1919. This is the root of the problem, as we shall see.
 
 Links to chapters at the bottom of this page:
 
 http://www.cactus48.com/truth.html

I have to agree with you, only this school year did i give a speech to my history class about the stealing, destruction and utter contempt the Israelis had for Palestinians. Since 70 A.D. the jews have been without a homeland. Then miraculously after the second World War a plot of land, their original home has not been inhabited for all that time. The Arabs who took the land from the Byzantines in about 622 A.D. have lived there. Unless there are two Palestines that exist in the Middle East then I can't see how it is inhabited and not at the same time. All these claims to ancient land would be as an indian asking a family move to move because his people lived there before, hundreds of years later. The nerve of the Jews to presume that they can use utter land fraud and the pity of the "Civilized" world to gain land is disgusting. People must see the truth and look beyond a man with his bomb strapped to his chest to the homless peolple of Palestine not the Western backed tribes of Israel.

 Of course a great deal of what you say here is true - but you have
 to factor in liberal sympathy for the Jewish cause which was articulated in 
 the Balfour Declaration of 1917 and which was sharpened up immensely because of the
 persecution of the Jews during the Second World War. This doesn't justify
 the confiscation of Arab lands - but it's surely an extenuating circumstance.

"If the lie is big enough and told often enough, it will be believed"
 
 Goebbels
 
 So the lies are perpetuated about "ownership" of the land encompassing what is now Jordan, Israel and the Palestinian authority. History is so clear on this subject it's not even funny at this point.
 
 The propaganda being force fed here is without any historical background/significance.

that the true owners of the land are the Canaanites.
